trans-unit.source: When overridden in a derived class, represents a data store for writing and reading user annotations.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore"></xref> class.
Adds a new <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation"></xref> to the store.

When a new <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> is added to the store its [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_guid](~/includes/tlasharptla-guid-md.md)] <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Id%2A> property is set to a new value.

When <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.AddAnnotation%2A> is called, its <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Id%2A> property is checked to see if the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> already has been added to the store.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> already has been added and exists in the store (as determined by its <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Id%2A> property) an <xref:System.ArgumentException> error is thrown.
The annotation to add to the store.
newAnnotation is `null`.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation"></xref> with the same <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Id"></xref> property value already exists in the store.
<xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose*"></xref> has been called on the store.
Occurs when an anchor on any <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation"></xref> in the store changes.

The <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.AnchorChanged> event can be used to monitor changes to the annotation <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Anchors%2A> contained in the store without the need to register on each <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> individually.
Occurs when an author on any <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation"></xref> in the store changes.

The <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.AnchorChanged> event can be used to monitor changes to the annotation <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Authors%2A> contained in the store without the need to register on each <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> individually.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether data in annotation buffers is to be written immediately to the physical data store.

Applications that use an explicit-save model can set <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.AutoFlush%2A> to `false` and call <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Flush%2A> directly when appropriate.

Applications that use an implicit-save model can set <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.AutoFlush%2A> to `true` to cause <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Flush%2A> to be called automatically after every store operation (add, delete, or modify).

`true` if data in annotation buffers is to be written immediately to the physical data store for each operation; otherwise, `false` if data in the annotation buffers is to be written when the application explicitly calls <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Flush"></xref>.
Occurs when a cargo on any <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation"></xref> in the store changes.

The <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.CargoChanged> event can be used to monitor changes to the annotation <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Cargos%2A> contained in the store without the need to register on each <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> individually.
Deletes the annotation with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Id"></xref> from the store.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_guid](~/includes/tlasharptla-guid-md.md)] <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Id"></xref> property of the annotation to be deleted.
The annotation that was deleted; otherwise, `null` if an annotation with the specified annotationId was not found in the store.
<xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose*"></xref> has been called on the store.
Releases all managed and unmanaged resources used by the store.
Applications should call <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose%2A> when finished with the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore>.

After calling <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose%2A> the application can release all references to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore> to allow the garbage collector to reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore> was occupying.

For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).

The public <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose%2A> method calls the protected <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose%2A>`(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter of `true` to release all managed and unmanaged resources.
Call <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose%2A> before the last reference to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore> is released.

If <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose%2A> is not called, <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore> resources will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the store's <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Finalize%2A> method.
Releases the unmanaged resources used by the store and optionally releases the managed resources.

This protected <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose%2A> method is called by the public <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose%2A>and <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> methods.

The public <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose%2A> invokes the protected <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose%2A>`(Boolean)` method with the `disposing` parameter set to `true`.
<xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> invokes <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose%2A> with `disposing` set to `false`.

When the `disposing` parameter is `true`, <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose%2A> releases all resources held by any managed objects that the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore> references.
<xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose%2A> also invokes the `Dispose()` method of each referenced object.
`true` to release both managed and unmanaged resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Guarantees that <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose(System.Boolean)"></xref> will eventually be called for this store.
This method overrides base <xref:System.Object.Finalize%2A> method.
The application program should not call <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Finalize%2A> directly.
<xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Finalize%2A> is automatically invoked during garbage collection unless disabled by a call to the <xref:System.GC.SuppressFinalize%2A> method.

For more information, see [Finalize Methods and Destructors](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/fd376774-1643-499b-869e-9546a3aeea70), [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md), and [Overriding the Finalize Method](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/8026cb68-fe93-43fc-96c1-c09ad7d64cd3).
Forces any annotation data retained in internal buffers to be written to the underlying storage device.

Applications that use an explicit-save model can set <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.AutoFlush%2A> to `false` and call <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Flush%2A> directly when appropriate.

Applications that use an implicit-save model can set the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.AutoFlush%2A> to `true` to cause <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Flush%2A> to be called automatically after every store operation (add, delete, or modify).
<xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose*"></xref> has been called on the store.
Returns the annotation with the specified <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Id"></xref> from the store.
The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_guid](~/includes/tlasharptla-guid-md.md)] <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Id"></xref> property of the annotation to be returned.
The annotation with the given annotationId; or `null`, if an annotation with the specified annotationId was not found in the store.
<xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose*"></xref> has been called on the store.
Returns a list of all the annotations in the store.
The list of all annotations currently contained in the store.
<xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose*"></xref> has been called on the store.

Returns a list of annotations that have <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Anchors"></xref> with locators that begin with a matching <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart"></xref> sequence.

This <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.GetAnnotations%2A> method internally uses the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator.StartsWith%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocator> class to search and match for the annotations to return.
The starting <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart"></xref> sequence to return matching annotations for.
The list of annotations that have with locators that start and match the given anchorLocator; otherwise, `null` if no matching annotations were found.
Gets a value that indicates whether <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose*"></xref> has been called.
`true` if <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.Dispose*"></xref> has been called; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.AnchorChanged"></xref> event.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.AuthorChanged"></xref> event.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.CargoChanged"></xref> event.
The event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore.StoreContentChanged"></xref> event.
The event data.
Occurs when an <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation"></xref> is added to or deleted from the store.
Gets the object to use as a synchronization lock for <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore"></xref> critical sections.
The object to use as a synchronization lock for <xref href="System.Windows.Annotations.Storage.AnnotationStore"></xref> critical sections.
